Two big pumper trucks curve past us, following a di road through the pasture we didn’t see until now. They roar on by, none of the firemen taking the slightest notice of Walt. They’re heading for Krazy-8's brush fire mile away. We can see the crooked column of SMOKE from he The SIRENS and the ROAR fade away. Gradually, the pasture grows silent again. Walt stares stupidly, the pistol dangling at his side. He lets it drop to the dirt. He stands blinking, trying to figure out what the hell ju happened. Pure, dumb luck. Beginner’s luck. As he stands here, the door to the RV opens behind him. Dupree stumbles out, pulls off his gas mask. Half his fac is swollen like a balloon, but he’1l recover. Dupree wanders over, stands next to Walt. Dazed silence.

dialogues.speaker: DUPREE
dialogues.text: What happened..? (nods toward the RV) W-What’d you do? Walt is weirdly matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Red phosphorus, when heat is applied... oxidizes and yields carbonyl chloride. Phosgene gas. One good whiff of it... He shrugs, trails off. Folds at the waist and THROWS UP. Dupree stands staring at nothing in particular. Walt rise wipes his mouth. He picks up his WALLET and CAMCORDER.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Gotta. Gotta clean this up. Gotta... bury... He slowly wanders back to the Winnebago. Dupree follows h Off our two new partners, who have only barely survived t first week together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Lights are off. Skyler and Walter, Jr. have gone to bed. Walt stands at the kitchen sink, washing Krazy-8’s c in Dawn dishwashing liquid. Washing off the toxic chemica He gives an involuntary shudder. He squeezes shut his eye which are tearing up. Tonight’s a night he’s never going forget -- whether he lives two years or two hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK FRAME. A DING, then a door opens -- revealing we’re inside the clothes dryer, looking out. Dry twenty dollar bills flutter around. Weary Walt reaches in and grabs the by the fistful. Walt quickly counts the money. Eight thousand and change. Walt jams it in a shoebox, snaps a rubber band around it. Remembering something, he reaches in his pocket... --. And pulls out the tiny camcorder TAPE. On it, we'll remember, is the confession to his family. He doesn’t destroy the tape. He thinks about it, then drops it into shoebox full of cash. Walt stands tiptoes on a chair, tucks the box way up in t garage rafters. Looking haunted, like hell warmed over, h climbs down and exits, turns off the light. DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skyler lies in bed, alone and awake. We’re on her as we h the door open. Quiet footsteps. Clothes come off. Walt gingerly climbs into bed, not wanting to wake his wi He lies motionless, staring up at the ceiling. A torrent thoughts rush through his head. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Where were you? Walt doesn’t answer. Skyler turns his way, stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Walt, I don’t know what is going on with you lately --

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: Nothing. I’m fine.  57.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: -- Whatever it is, I’1l tell you this. I do not like it when you don’t talk to me. The worst thing you can do is shut me out.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: I’m... I understand. I’m fine. She stares at him in the darkness. He stares at her. A strange feeling comes over him. It’s relief to be alive mixed with dread that life won’t last. It’s fear of being caught. It’s the thrill -- for once -- of taking risks. It’s excitement, in many different forms. And since he ca talk about it, there’s only one way to let it out. Walt kisses his wife. Passionately.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Walt... He keeps kissing her. Gently rolls her so that her back i to him. Out of sight under the covers, he fumbles with he panties, pulls them down. Surprised as hell, Skyler nonetheless allows it. She feel around behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLER
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Is that you? It sure is. The mighty oak. Walt enters her -- Skyler’s eyes pop wide, and we CUT TO BLACK. Over the sounds of HE BREATHING and the SQUEAK-SQUEAK-SQUEAKING of bed springs. -.. FADE UP CREDITS.
